avalancheActivity.comment: Following a mild night with overcast skies and reduced outgoing radiation, moderate danger prevails. Naturally triggered wet-snow and glide-snow avalanches can be expected, reaching medium size in high-altitude starting zones. Wet-snow avalanches can be triggered by persons in steep terrain. Due to rainfall, danger below 2400m could rise to Danger Level 3, considerable. In addition, the old snowpack can be triggered by persons, small-to-medium releases. Danger zones occur esp. on very steep NW/N/NE-facing slopes and are difficult to recognize. Backcounry tours require a cautious route selection. In high altitude ridgeline terrain, fresh drifts demand attentiveness.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Danger of wet avalanches even in the morning. Caution on very steep shady slopes in high-alpine zones.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowpack can’t consolidate well in the warm, cloudy nights, esp. on E/S/W-facing slopes up to high-alpine zones and on shady slopes below 2200m. The air is becoming moister, the old snowpack is thoroughly wet up to high altitudes. From the south, some showers are possible. Due to rainfall below 2400m the snowpack is being additionally weakened. In very steep shady terrain at high altitudes, unfavorable intermediate layers are evident inside the old snowpack. Brisk foehn wind will generated mostly small snowdrift accumulations in high-altitude ridgeline terrain. In shady wind-protected zones the uppermost layers are often soft.

tendency.highlights: On Monday afternoon, short rain showers, snowfall level at 2600m, are possible. Danger of wet-snow and glide-snow avalanches persists.

weatherForecast.comment: Compact clouds will pass through, but the summits will remain in the clear. Showers possible from the south, snowfall above 2400m. As of later afternoon, more pleasant conditions will be launched. Mild. At 2000m: 2-5 degrees. Moderate S/SW winds, brisker on the foehn mountains.

avalancheActivity.comment: Following a mild night with overcast skies and reduced outgoing radiation, moderate danger prevails. Naturally triggered wet-snow and glide-snow avalanches can be expected, reaching medium size in high-altitude starting zones. Wet-snow avalanches can be triggered by persons in steep terrain. In high-altitude ridgeline terrain, fresh snowdrifts require attentiveness. Isolated avalanches are possible by large additional loading in extremely steep terrain. Apart from the danger of being buried in snow masses, the risks of being swept along and forced to take a fall require adequate caution.

snowpackStructure.comment: The snowpack can’t consolidate well in the warm, cloudy nights, esp. on E/S/W-facing slopes up to high-alpine zones and on shady slopes below 2200m. The air is becoming moister, the old snowpack is thoroughly wet up to high altitudes. From the south, some showers are possible. Due to rainfall below 2400m the snowpack is being additionally weakened. In very steep shady terrain at high altitudes, unfavorable intermediate layers are evident inside the old snowpack. Brisk foehn wind will generated mostly small snowdrift accumulations in high-altitude ridgeline terrain. In shady wind-protected zones the uppermost layers are often soft. At low altitudes, little snow on the ground.

tendency.highlights: On Monday afternoon, short rain showers, snowfall level at 2600m, are possible. Danger of wet-snow and glide-snow avalanches persists.

weatherForecast.comment: Compact clouds will pass through, but the summits will remain in the clear. Showers possible from the south, snowfall above 2400m. As of later afternoon, more pleasant conditions will be launched. Mild. At 2000m: 2-5 degrees. Moderate S/SW winds, brisker on the foehn mountains.

customData.generalHeadline: Danger of wet avalanches even in the morning. Caution in high-alpine zones.
